meanings.definition: Miserly or stingy in giving or spending
meanings.sent1: He is known for being mingier than anyone else in our group when it comes to sharing snacks.
meanings.sent2: The rich man became even mingier after losing a significant amount of money in the stock market.
meanings.sent3: Despite his mingier nature, he surprised us all by donating a large sum to the charity event.
meanings.sent4: Her mingier attitude towards lending money made her friends hesitant to ask for help.
meanings.sent5: The old miser's mingier ways only became more pronounced as he grew older.

meanings.definition: Lacking generosity or willingness to spend money
meanings.sent1: She became even mingier with her compliments after the argument with her friend.
meanings.sent2: The company's mingier approach to employee benefits led to a decrease in morale.
meanings.sent3: His mingier behavior at the restaurant made the waiter wonder if he was unhappy with the service.
meanings.sent4: The mingier attitude of the landlord made the tenants hesitant to ask for repairs.
meanings.sent5: The mingier attitude of the boss resulted in lower motivation among the employees.

meanings.sent1: The mingier fabric used for the cheaper shirts made them less durable.
meanings.sent2: The mingier model of the car lacked the advanced features of the higher-end version.
meanings.sent3: Despite being mingier in size, the tiny house had a cozy and charming feel.
meanings.sent4: The mingier paint job on the house resulted in a less vibrant appearance.
meanings.sent5: The mingier screen resolution on the budget phone made it difficult to read text clearly.
